intro: Senecio castoreus, commonly known as the Castoreus groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soils. Senecio castoreus is also known for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
